subsection.heading: St. Charles County, Missouri, Land Exchange.—

paragraph.heading: Definitions.—
paragraph.chapeau: In this subsection:

subparagraph.heading: Federal land.—
subparagraph.content: The term “Federal land” means approximately 84 acres of land, as identified by the Secretary, that is a portion of the approximately 227 acres of land leased from the Corps of Engineers by Ameren Corporation for the Portage Des Sioux Power Plant in St. Charles County, Missouri (Lease No. DA-23-065–CIVENG–64–651, Pool 26).

subparagraph.heading: Non-federal land.—
subparagraph.content: The term “non-Federal land” means the approximately 68 acres of land owned by Ameren Corporation in Jersey County, Illinois, contained within the north half of section 23, township 6 north, range 11 west of the third principal meridian.

paragraph.heading: Land exchange.—
paragraph.content: On conveyance by Ameren Corporation to the United States of all right, title, and interest in and to the non-Federal land, the Secretary shall convey to Ameren Corporation all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Federal land.

clause.heading: Deed to non-federal land.—
clause.content: The Secretary may only accept conveyance of the non-Federal land by warranty deed, as determined acceptable by the Secretary.

clause.heading: Deed to federal land.—
clause.content: The Secretary shall convey the Federal land to Ameren Corporation by quitclaim deed.

subparagraph.heading: Cash payment.—
subparagraph.content: If the appraised fair market value of the Federal land, as determined by the Secretary, exceeds the appraised fair market value of the non-Federal land, as determined by the Secretary, Ameren Corporation shall make a cash payment to the United States reflecting the difference in the appraised fair market values.

subsection.heading: Tulsa Port of Catoosa, Rogers County, Oklahoma, Land Exchange.—

paragraph.heading: Definitions.—
paragraph.chapeau: In this subsection:

subparagraph.heading: Federal land.—
subparagraph.content: The term “Federal land” means the approximately 87 acres of land situated in Rogers County, Oklahoma, contained within United States Tracts 413 and 427 and acquired for the McClellan-Kerr Arkansas Navigation System.

subparagraph.heading: Non-federal land.—
subparagraph.content: The term “non-Federal land” means the approximately 34 acres of land situated in 128 STAT. 1358Rogers County, Oklahoma, and owned by the Tulsa Port of Catoosa that lie immediately south and east of the Federal land.

paragraph.heading: Land exchange.—
paragraph.content: On conveyance by the Tulsa Port of Catoosa to the United States of all right, title, and interest in and to the non-Federal land, the Secretary shall convey to the Tulsa Port of Catoosa all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Federal land.

clause.heading: Deed to non-federal land.—
clause.content: The Secretary may only accept conveyance of the non-Federal land by warranty deed, as determined acceptable by the Secretary.

clause.heading: Deed to federal land.—
clause.content: The Secretary shall convey the Federal land to the Tulsa Port of Catoosa by quitclaim deed and subject to any reservations, terms, and conditions the Secretary determines necessary to allow the United States to operate and maintain the McClellan-Kerr Arkansas River Navigation System.

clause.heading: Cash payment.—
clause.content: If the appraised fair market value of the Federal land, as determined by the Secretary, exceeds the appraised fair market value of the non-Federal land, as determined by the Secretary, the Tulsa Port of Catoosa shall make a cash payment to the United States reflecting the difference in the appraised fair market values.

paragraph.heading: Definitions.—
paragraph.chapeau: In this subsection:

subparagraph.heading: City.—
subparagraph.content: The term “City” means the city of Warrenton, located in Clatsop County, Oregon.

subparagraph.heading: Map.—
subparagraph.content: The term “map” means the map contained in Exhibit A of Department of the Army Lease No. DACW57–1–88–0033 (or a successor instrument).

paragraph.heading: Conveyance authority.—
paragraph.content: Subject to the provisions of this subsection, the Secretary shall convey to the City by quitclaim deed, and without consideration, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the parcel of land described in paragraph (3).

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.content: Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the land referred to in paragraph (2) is the parcel totaling approximately 59 acres located in the City, together with any improvements thereon, including the Hammond Marina (as described in the map).

subparagraph.heading: Exclusion.—
subparagraph.content: The land referred to in paragraph (2) shall not include the site provided for the fisheries research support facility of the National Marine Fisheries Service.

subparagraph.heading: Availability of map.—
subparagraph.content: The map shall be on file in the Portland District Office of the Corps of Engineers.

paragraph.heading: Terms and conditions.—
paragraph.content: As a condition of the conveyance under this subsection, the Secretary may impose a requirement that the City assume full responsibility for operating and maintaining the channel and the breakwater.128 STAT. 1359

paragraph.heading: Reversion.—
paragraph.content: If the Secretary determines that the land conveyed under this subsection ceases to be owned by the public, all right, title, and interest in and to the land shall revert, at the discretion of the Secretary, to the United States.

paragraph.heading: Deauthorization.—
paragraph.content: After the land is conveyed under this subsection, the land shall no longer be a portion of the project for navigation, Hammond Small Boat Basin, Oregon, authorized by section 107 of the Rivers and Harbor Act of 1960 (33 U.S.C. 577).

subsection.heading: Craney Island Dredged Material Management Area, Portsmouth, Virginia.—

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: Subject to the conditions described in this subsection, the Secretary may convey to the Commonwealth of Virginia, by quitclaim deed and without consideration, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to 2 parcels of land situated within the project for navigation, Craney Island Eastward Expansion, Norfolk Harbor and Channels, Hampton Roads, Virginia, authorized by section 1001(45) of the Water Resources Development Act of 2007 (Public Law 110–114; 121 Stat. 1057), together with any improvements thereon.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.content: The 2 parcels of land to be conveyed under this subsection include a parcel consisting of approximately 307.82 acres of land and a parcel consisting of approximately 13.33 acres of land, both located along the eastern side of the Craney Island Dredged Material Management Area in Portsmouth, Virginia.

subparagraph.heading: Use.—
subparagraph.content: The 2 parcels of land described in subparagraph (A) may be used by the Commonwealth of Virginia exclusively for the purpose of port expansion, including the provision of road and rail access and the construction of a shipping container terminal.

paragraph.heading: Reversion.—
paragraph.content: If the Secretary determines that the land conveyed under this subsection ceases to be owned by the public or is used for any purpose that is inconsistent with paragraph (2), all right, title, and interest in and to the land shall revert, at the discretion of the Secretary, to the United States.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary shall convey to the city of Asotin, Asotin County, Washington, without monetary consideration, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the land described in paragraph (3).

paragraph.heading: Reversion.—
paragraph.content: If the land transferred under this subsection ceases at any time to be used for a public purpose, the land shall revert to the United States.

paragraph.heading: Description.—
paragraph.chapeau: The land to be conveyed to the city of Asotin, Washington, under this subsection are—

subparagraph.content: other leased areas designated as Tracts 1506, 1522, 1523, 1524, 1525, 1526, 1527, 1529, 1530, 1531, and 1563.

paragraph.heading: Survey to obtain legal description.—
paragraph.content: The exact acreage and the legal description of any real property to be conveyed 128 STAT. 1360under this section shall be determined by a survey that is satisfactory to the Secretary.

paragraph.heading: Applicability of property screening provisions.—
paragraph.content: Section 2696 of title 10, United States Code, shall not apply to any conveyance under this section.

paragraph.heading: Additional terms and conditions.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary may require that any conveyance under this section be subject to such additional terms and conditions as the Secretary considers necessary and appropriate to protect the interests of the United States.

paragraph.heading: Costs of conveyance.—
paragraph.content: An entity to which a conveyance is made under this section shall be responsible for all reasonable and necessary costs, including real estate transaction and environmental documentation costs, associated with the conveyance.

paragraph.heading: Liability.—
paragraph.content: An entity to which a conveyance is made under this section shall hold the United States harmless from any liability with respect to activities carried out, on or after the date of the conveyance, on the real property conveyed. The United States shall remain responsible for any liability with respect to activities carried out, before such date, on the real property conveyed.

subsection.heading: Release of Use Restrictions.—
subsection.content: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Tennessee Valley Authority shall, without monetary consideration, grant releases from real estate restrictions established pursuant to section 4(k)(b) of the Tennessee Valley Authority Act of 1933 (16 U.S.C. 831c(k)(b)) with respect to tracts of land identified in section 4(k)(b) of that Act, subject to the condition that such releases shall be granted in a manner consistent with applicable Tennessee Valley Authority policies.

subsection.heading: In General.—
subsection.chapeau: Not later than February 1 of each year, the Secretary shall develop and submit to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives an annual report, to be entitled “Report to Congress on Future Water Resources Development”, that identifies the following:

paragraph.heading: Feasibility reports.—
paragraph.content: Each feasibility report that meets the criteria established in subsection (c)(1)(A).

paragraph.heading: Proposed feasibility studies.—
paragraph.content: Any proposed feasibility study submitted to the Secretary by a non-Federal interest pursuant to subsection (b) that meets the criteria established in subsection (c)(1)(A).

paragraph.heading: Proposed modifications.—
paragraph.chapeau: Any proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study that meets the criteria established in subsection (c)(1)(A) that—

subparagraph.content: is submitted to the Secretary by a non-Federal interest pursuant to subsection (b); or
is identified by the Secretary for authorization.

paragraph.heading: Publication.—
paragraph.content: Not later than May 1 of each year, the Secretary shall publish in the Federal Register a notice requesting proposals from non-Federal interests for proposed feasibility studies and proposed modifications to authorized water resources development projects and feasibility studies to be included in the annual report.

paragraph.heading: Deadline for requests.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary shall include in each notice required by this subsection a requirement that non-Federal interests submit to the Secretary any proposals described in paragraph (1) by not later than 120 days after the date of publication of the notice in the Federal Register in order for the proposals to be considered for inclusion in the annual report.

paragraph.heading: Notification.—
paragraph.chapeau: On the date of publication of each notice required by this subsection, the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.content: make the notice publicly available, including on the Internet; and
provide written notification of the publication to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives.

paragraph.heading: Feasibility reports, proposed feasibility studies, and proposed modifications.—

subparagraph.heading: Criteria for inclusion in report.—
subparagraph.chapeau: The Secretary shall include in the annual report only those feasibility reports, proposed feasibility studies, and proposed modifications to authorized water resources development projects and feasibility studies that—

clause.content: are related to the missions and authorities of the Corps of Engineers;
require specific congressional authorization, including by an Act of Congress;
have not been congressionally authorized;
have not been included in any previous annual report; and
if authorized, could be carried out by the Corps of Engineers.

clause.heading: Description.—
clause.content: The Secretary shall describe in the annual report, to the extent applicable and practicable, for each proposed feasibility study and proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study included in the annual report, the benefits, as described in clause (ii), of each such study or proposed modification (including the water resources development project that is the subject of the proposed feasibility study or the proposed modification to an authorized feasibility study).

clause.heading: Benefits.—
clause.chapeau: The benefits (or expected benefits, in the case of a proposed feasibility study) described in this clause are benefits to—

subclause.content: the protection of human life and property;
improvement to transportation;
the national economy;
the environment; or128 STAT. 1362
the national security interests of the United States.

subparagraph.heading: Identification of other factors.—
subparagraph.chapeau: The Secretary shall identify in the annual report, to the extent practicable—

clause.content: for each proposed feasibility study included in the annual report, the non-Federal interest that submitted the proposed feasibility study pursuant to subsection (b); and

clause.chapeau: for each proposed feasibility study and proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study included in the annual report, whether the non-Federal interest has demonstrated—

subclause.content: that local support exists for the proposed feasibility study or proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study (including the water resources development project that is the subject of the proposed feasibility study or the proposed modification to an authorized feasibility study); and
the financial ability to provide the required non-Federal cost share.

paragraph.heading: Transparency.—
paragraph.chapeau: The Secretary shall include in the annual report, for each feasibility report, proposed feasibility study, and proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study included under paragraph (1)(A)—

subparagraph.chapeau: the name of the associated non-Federal interest, including the name of any non-Federal interest that has contributed, or is expected to contribute, a non-Federal share of the cost of—

clause.content: the feasibility report;
the proposed feasibility study;
the authorized feasibility study for which the modification is proposed; or

clause.chapeau: construction of—

subclause.chapeau: the water resources development project that is the subject of—

item.content: the authorized feasibility study for which a modification is proposed; or

subclause.content: the proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project;

subparagraph.content: a letter or statement of support for the feasibility report, proposed feasibility study, or proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study from each associated non-Federal interest;
the purpose of the feasibility report, proposed feasibility study, or proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study;

subparagraph.chapeau: an estimate, to the extent practicable, of the Federal, non-Federal, and total costs of—

clause.content: the proposed modification to an authorized feasibility study; and

clause.chapeau: construction of—128 STAT. 1363

subclause.chapeau: the water resources development project that is the subject of—

item.content: the authorized feasibility study for which a modification is proposed, with respect to the change in costs resulting from such modification; or

subclause.content: the proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project; and

subparagraph.chapeau: an estimate, to the extent practicable, of the monetary and nonmonetary benefits of—

clause.chapeau: the water resources development project that is the subject of—

subclause.content: the feasibility report; or
the authorized feasibility study for which a modification is proposed, with respect to the benefits of such modification; or

clause.content: the proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project.

paragraph.heading: Certification.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary shall include in the annual report a certification stating that each feasibility report, proposed feasibility study, and proposed modification to an authorized water resources development project or feasibility study included in the annual report meets the criteria established in paragraph (1)(A).

paragraph.heading: Appendix.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary shall include in the annual report an appendix listing the proposals submitted under subsection (b) that were not included in the annual report under paragraph (1)(A) and a description of why the Secretary determined that those proposals did not meet the criteria for inclusion under such paragraph.

subsection.heading: Special Rule for Initial Annual Report.—
subsection.chapeau: Notwithstanding any other deadlines required by this section, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.content: not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, publish in the Federal Register a notice required by subsection (b)(1); and

include in such notice a requirement that non-Federal interests submit to the Secretary any proposals described in subsection (b)(1) by not later than 120 days after the date of publication of such notice in the Federal Register in order for such proposals to be considered for inclusion in the first annual report developed by the Secretary under this section.

subsection.heading: Publication.—
subsection.content: Upon submission of an annual report to Congress, the Secretary shall make the annual report publicly available, including through publication on the Internet.

subsection.heading: Definitions.—
subsection.chapeau: In this section:

paragraph.heading: Annual report.—
paragraph.content: The term “annual report” means a report required by subsection (a).

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.content: The term “feasibility report” means a final feasibility report developed under section 905 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 (33 U.S.C. 2282).

subparagraph.heading: Inclusions.—
subparagraph.chapeau: The term “feasibility report” includes—128 STAT. 1364

clause.content: a report described in section 105(d)(2) of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 (33 U.S.C. 2215(d)(2)); and
where applicable, any associated report of the Chief of Engineers.

paragraph.heading: Feasibility study.—
paragraph.content: The term “feasibility study” has the meaning given that term in section 105 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 (33 U.S.C. 2215).

paragraph.heading: Non-federal interest.—
paragraph.content: The term “non-Federal interest” has the meaning given that term in section 221 of the Flood Control Act of 1970 (42 U.S.C. 1962d–5b).

section.chapeau: The following final feasibility studies for water resources development and conservation and other purposes are authorized to be carried out by the Secretary substantially in accordance with the plan, and subject to the conditions, described in the respective reports designated in this section:

section.heading: EXPEDITED CONSIDERATION IN THE HOUSE AND SENATE.

subsection.heading: Consideration in the House of Representatives.—

paragraph.heading: Definition of interim authorization bill.—
paragraph.chapeau: In this subsection, the term “interim authorization bill” means a bill 128 STAT. 1373of the 113th Congress introduced after the date of enactment of this Act in the House of Representatives by the chair of the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure which—

subparagraph.content: has the following title: “A bill to provide for the authorization of certain water resources development or conservation projects outside the regular authorization cycle.”; and

subparagraph.chapeau: only contains—

clause.content: authorization for 1 or more water resources development or conservation projects for which a final report of the Chief of Engineers has been completed; or
deauthorization for 1 or more water resources development or conservation projects.

paragraph.heading: Expedited consideration.—
paragraph.content: If an interim authorization bill is not reported by a committee to which it is referred within 30 calendar days, the committee shall be discharged from its further consideration and the bill shall be referred to the appropriate calendar.

paragraph.heading: Policy.—
paragraph.content: The benefits of water resource projects designed and carried out in an economically justifiable, environmentally acceptable, and technically sound manner are important to the economy and environment of the United States and recommendations to Congress regarding those projects should be expedited for approval in a timely manner.

paragraph.heading: Applicability.—
paragraph.chapeau: The procedures under this subsection apply to projects for water resources development, conservation, and other purposes, subject to the conditions that—

subparagraph.chapeau: each project is carried out—

clause.content: substantially in accordance with the plan identified in the report of the Chief of Engineers for the project; and
subject to any conditions described in the report for the project; and
a report of the Chief of Engineers has been completed; and
after the date of enactment of this Act, the Assistant Secretary of the Army for Civil Works has submitted to Congress a recommendation to authorize construction of the project.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.chapeau: A bill shall be eligible for expedited consideration in accordance with this subsection if the bill—

clause.content: authorizes a project that meets the requirements described in paragraph (2); and
is referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate.

clause.heading: In general.—
clause.chapeau: Not later than January 31st of the second session of each Congress, the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate shall—

subclause.content: report all bills that meet the requirements of subparagraph (A); or128 STAT. 1374
introduce and report a measure to authorize any project that meets the requirements described in paragraph (2).

clause.heading: Failure to act.—
clause.content: Subject to clause (iii), if the committee fails to act on a bill that meets the requirements of subparagraph (A) by the date specified in clause (i), the bill shall be discharged from the committee and placed on the calendar of the Senate.

clause.heading: Exceptions.—
clause.chapeau: Clause (ii) shall not apply if—

subclause.content: in the 180-day period immediately preceding the date specified in clause (i), the full committee holds a legislative hearing on a bill to authorize all projects that meet the requirements described in paragraph (2);

item.content: the committee favorably reports a bill to authorize all projects that meet the requirements described in paragraph (2); and
the bill described in item (aa) is placed on the calendar of the Senate; or

subclause.content: a bill that meets the requirements of subparagraph (A) is referred to the committee not earlier than 30 days before the date specified in clause (i).

paragraph.heading: Termination.—
paragraph.content: The procedures for expedited consideration under this subsection terminate on December 31, 2018.

subsection.heading: Rules of the Senate and House of Representatives.—
subsection.chapeau: This section is enacted by Congress—

paragraph.content: as an exercise of the rulemaking power of the Senate and House of Representatives, respectively, and as such it is deemed a part of the rules of each House, respectively, but applicable only with respect to the procedure to be followed in that House in the case of a bill addressed by this section, and it supersedes other rules only to the extent that it is inconsistent with such rules; and

with full recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change the rules (so far as relating to the procedure of that House) at any time, in the same manner, and to the same extent as in the case of any other rule of that House.
